description.narrative: The Central African Republic (CAR) has a long history of political upheaval, and suffers from chronic under-development, poor governance and institutional capacity, lack of accountability, and inter-communal tension. CAR authorities - in tandem with the United Nations (UN) and international partners -are focused on bringing security and stability to CAR, resuming basic government functions and services, improving public financial management, and advancing an inclusive political process that is representative of ethnic, regional, and religious diversity found in CAR. U.S. foreign assistance supports the call from Central Africans to build a country that is unified, peaceful, stable, prosperous, tolerant, and accountable. As such, U.S. priorities include helping CAR re-establish a justice system; investing in local-level conflict mitigation efforts; supporting disarmament, demobilization, rehabilitation, and reintegration; providing assistance for security sector reform; and making targeted investments to support the economic revitalization and governance improvements that are necessary for long-term development and recovery. The U.S. government will continue to coordinate efforts closely with other donors in CAR, including the UN, the European Union, France, World Bank, African Development Bank, and International Monetary Fund.
